Package games

Class Player

java.lang.Object
games.Card
games.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
Euchre
public class Player
extends Card
A Class to create a player for the Euchre class.
Author:
Matthew Polter

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      public Player​(int playerNum, boolean isDealer, boolean isPlayerTurn)
      Create a new player.
      Parameters:
      playerNum - Sets the player number.
      isDealer - Sets whether or not the player is the current dealer.
      isPlayerTurn - Sets whether or not it is currently this players turn.

  • Method Details

    • getPlayerNumber

      public int getPlayerNumber()
      Gets the current number of this player.
      Returns:
      Get the player number

    • isDealer

      public boolean isDealer()
      Returns a boolean value telling whether or not this player is currently the dealer.
      Returns:
      True if the player is the dealer, false otherwise.

    • isPlayerTurn

      public boolean isPlayerTurn()
      Returns a boolean value telling whether or not it is currently this players turn.
      Returns:
      True if it is the players turn, false otherwise.

    • setPlayerTurn

      public void setPlayerTurn​(boolean isPlayerTurn)
      Sets the players turn to some boolean value.
      Parameters:
      isPlayerTurn - Sets isPlayerTurn to whatever boolean value is given in this parameter.

    • setPreroundCards

      public void setPreroundCards​(Card[] arr)
      Gives this player the number of cards in the parameter.
      Parameters:
      arr - Give an array of cards to this player to start the game.

    • giveCard

      public void giveCard​(Card card)
      Give an additional card to a player.
      Parameters:
      card - Gives a card object to the player.

    • getCard

      public Card getCard​(int index)
      Get one of the players cards at a specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the card you want to return.
      Returns:
      The card at the index given as a parameter.

    • getCards

      public java.util.ArrayList<Card> getCards()
      Returns the full array of this players cards.
      Returns:
      The ArrayList of cards that the player currently has.
